result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason A Girtler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant to pay all costs, fees, and surcharges. Court ordered bail on deposit to be applied towards costs, fees, and surcharges. Any remaining amount not covered by the cash bail is to be paid by 5/28/15. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay DNA surcharge. If defendant has already paid a DNA surcharge on prior criminal case, the Court will WAIVE the DNA surcharge in this case.

Court advised advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason A Girtler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason A Girtler in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded.

Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNT 1-
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Jason A Girtler in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State. Defense requests adjourned scheduling date to review the discovery. State does not object. Court grants defense request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

15RM003108  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:

Defendant Jason A Girtler in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Defendant Jason A Girtler in custody.  Jesica Ballenger for Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason A Girtler in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Jason A Girtler in custody.  Karl Hayes for Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jason A Girtler in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Jason A Girtler in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. aa
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
